title: Square Connect
description: Client library for accessing the Square Connect APIs

ListEmployees.title: Provides summary information for all of a business's employees.
ListEmployees.description: Provides summary information for all of a business's employees.

CreateEmployee.title: Creates an employee for a business.
CreateEmployee.description: Creates an employee for a business.

RetrieveEmployee.title: Provides the details for a single employee.
RetrieveEmployee.description: Provides the details for a single employee.

get_v1_me_locations.title: Provides details for a business's locations, including their IDs.
get_v1_me_locations.description: Provides details for a business's locations, including their IDs.

ListEmployeeRoles.title: Provides summary information for all of a business's employee roles.
ListEmployeeRoles.description: Provides summary information for all of a business's employee roles.

CreateEmployeeRole.title: Creates an employee role you can then assign to employees.
CreateEmployeeRole.description: Creates an employee role you can then assign to employees.

RetrieveEmployeeRole.title: Provides the details for a single employee role.
RetrieveEmployeeRole.description: Provides the details for a single employee role.

UpdateEmployeeRole.title: Modifies the details of an employee role.
UpdateEmployeeRole.description: Modifies the details of an employee role.

ListTimecards.title: Provides summary information for all of a business's employee timecards.
ListTimecards.description: Provides summary information for all of a business's employee timecards.

CreateTimecard.title: Creates a timecard for an employee. Each timecard corresponds to a single shift.
CreateTimecard.description: Creates a timecard for an employee. Each timecard corresponds to a single shift.

DeleteTimecard.title: Deletes a timecard. Deleted timecards are still accessible from Connect API endpoints, but the value of their deleted field is set to true. See Handling deleted timecards for more information.
DeleteTimecard.description: Deletes a timecard. Deleted timecards are still accessible from Connect API endpoints, but the value of their deleted field is set to true. See Handling deleted timecards for more information.

RetrieveTimecard.title: Provides the details for a single timecard.
RetrieveTimecard.description: Provides the details for a single timecard.

UpdateTimecard.title: Modifies a timecard's details. This creates an API_EDIT event for the timecard. You can view a timecard's event history with the List Timecard Events endpoint.
UpdateTimecard.description: Modifies a timecard's details. This creates an API_EDIT event for the timecard. You can view a timecard's event history with the List Timecard Events endpoint.

ListTimecardEvents.title: Provides summary information for all events associated with a particular timecard.
ListTimecardEvents.description: Provides summary information for all events associated with a particular timecard.

ListBankAccounts.title: Provides non-confidential details for all of a location's associated bank accounts. This endpoint does not provide full bank account numbers, and there is no way to obtain a full bank account number with the Connect API.
ListBankAccounts.description: Provides non-confidential details for all of a location's associated bank accounts. This endpoint does not provide full bank account numbers, and there is no way to obtain a full bank account number with the Connect API.

RetrieveBankAccount.title: Provides non-confidential details for a merchant's associated bank account. This endpoint does not provide full bank account numbers, and there is no way to obtain a full bank account number with the Connect API.
RetrieveBankAccount.description: Provides non-confidential details for a merchant's associated bank account. This endpoint does not provide full bank account numbers, and there is no way to obtain a full bank account number with the Connect API.

ListCashDrawerShifts.title: Provides the details for all of a location's cash drawer shifts during a date range. The date range you specify cannot exceed 90 days.
ListCashDrawerShifts.description: Provides the details for all of a location's cash drawer shifts during a date range. The date range you specify cannot exceed 90 days.

RetrieveCashDrawerShift.title: Provides the details for a single cash drawer shift, including all events that occurred during the shift.
RetrieveCashDrawerShift.description: Provides the details for a single cash drawer shift, including all events that occurred during the shift.

ListCategories.title: Lists all of a location's item categories.
ListCategories.description: Lists all of a location's item categories.

UpdateCategory.title: Modifies the details of an existing item category.
UpdateCategory.description: Modifies the details of an existing item category.

ListDiscounts.title: Lists all of a location's discounts.
ListDiscounts.description: Lists all of a location's discounts.

UpdateDiscount.title: Modifies the details of an existing discount.
UpdateDiscount.description: Modifies the details of an existing discount.

ListFees.title: Lists all of a location's fees (taxes).
ListFees.description: Lists all of a location's fees (taxes).

UpdateFee.title: Modifies the details of an existing fee (tax).
UpdateFee.description: Modifies the details of an existing fee (tax).

ListInventory.title: Provides inventory information for all of a merchant's inventory-enabled item variations.
ListInventory.description: Provides inventory information for all of a merchant's inventory-enabled item variations.

AdjustInventory.title: Adjusts an item variation's current available inventory.
AdjustInventory.description: Adjusts an item variation's current available inventory.

ListItems.title: Provides summary information for all of a location's items.
ListItems.description: Provides summary information for all of a location's items.

CreateItem.title: Creates an item and at least one variation for it.
CreateItem.description: Creates an item and at least one variation for it.

DeleteItem.title: Deletes an existing item and all item variations associated with it.
DeleteItem.description: Deletes an existing item and all item variations associated with it.

RetrieveItem.title: Provides the details for a single item, including associated modifier lists and fees.
RetrieveItem.description: Provides the details for a single item, including associated modifier lists and fees.

UpdateItem.title: Modifies the core details of an existing item.
UpdateItem.description: Modifies the core details of an existing item.

RemoveFee.title: Removes a fee assocation from an item, meaning the fee is no longer automatically applied to the item in Square Register.
RemoveFee.description: Removes a fee assocation from an item, meaning the fee is no longer automatically applied to the item in Square Register.

ApplyFee.title: Associates a fee with an item, meaning the fee is automatically applied to the item in Square Register.
ApplyFee.description: Associates a fee with an item, meaning the fee is automatically applied to the item in Square Register.

RemoveModifierList.title: Removes a modifier list association from an item, meaning modifier options from the list can no longer be applied to the item.
RemoveModifierList.description: Removes a modifier list association from an item, meaning modifier options from the list can no longer be applied to the item.

ApplyModifierList.title: Associates a modifier list with an item, meaning modifier options from the list can be applied to the item.
ApplyModifierList.description: Associates a modifier list with an item, meaning modifier options from the list can be applied to the item.

CreateVariation.title: Creates an item variation for an existing item.
CreateVariation.description: Creates an item variation for an existing item.

DeleteVariation.title: Deletes an existing item variation from an item.
DeleteVariation.description: Deletes an existing item variation from an item.

UpdateVariation.title: Modifies the details of an existing item variation.
UpdateVariation.description: Modifies the details of an existing item variation.

ListModifierLists.title: Lists all of a location's modifier lists.
ListModifierLists.description: Lists all of a location's modifier lists.

CreateModifierList.title: Creates an item modifier list and at least one modifier option for it.
CreateModifierList.description: Creates an item modifier list and at least one modifier option for it.

DeleteModifierList.title: Deletes an existing item modifier list and all modifier options associated with it.
DeleteModifierList.description: Deletes an existing item modifier list and all modifier options associated with it.

RetrieveModifierList.title: Provides the details for a single modifier list.
RetrieveModifierList.description: Provides the details for a single modifier list.

UpdateModifierList.title: Modifies the details of an existing item modifier list.
UpdateModifierList.description: Modifies the details of an existing item modifier list.

CreateModifierOption.title: Creates an item modifier option and adds it to a modifier list.
CreateModifierOption.description: Creates an item modifier option and adds it to a modifier list.

DeleteModifierOption.title: Deletes an existing item modifier option from a modifier list.
DeleteModifierOption.description: Deletes an existing item modifier option from a modifier list.

UpdateModifierOption.title: Modifies the details of an existing item modifier option.
UpdateModifierOption.description: Modifies the details of an existing item modifier option.

ListOrders.title: Provides summary information for a merchant's online store orders.
ListOrders.description: Provides summary information for a merchant's online store orders.

RetrieveOrder.title: Provides comprehensive information for a single online store order, including the order's history.
RetrieveOrder.description: Provides comprehensive information for a single online store order, including the order's history.

UpdateOrder.title: Updates the details of an online store order. Every update you perform on an order corresponds to one of three actions:
UpdateOrder.description: Updates the details of an online store order. Every update you perform on an order corresponds to one of three actions:

ListPages.title: Lists all of a location's Favorites pages in Square Register.
ListPages.description: Lists all of a location's Favorites pages in Square Register.

CreatePage.title: Creates a Favorites page in Square Register.
CreatePage.description: Creates a Favorites page in Square Register.

DeletePage.title: Deletes an existing Favorites page and all of its cells.
DeletePage.description: Deletes an existing Favorites page and all of its cells.

UpdatePage.title: Modifies the details of a Favorites page in Square Register.
UpdatePage.description: Modifies the details of a Favorites page in Square Register.

DeletePageCell.title: Deletes a cell from a Favorites page in Square Register.
DeletePageCell.description: Deletes a cell from a Favorites page in Square Register.

UpdatePageCell.title: Modifies a cell of a Favorites page in Square Register.
UpdatePageCell.description: Modifies a cell of a Favorites page in Square Register.

ListPayments.title: Provides summary information for all payments taken by a merchant or any of the merchant's mobile staff during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length. See Date ranges for details of inclusive and exclusive dates.
ListPayments.description: Provides summary information for all payments taken by a merchant or any of the merchant's mobile staff during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length. See Date ranges for details of inclusive and exclusive dates.

RetrievePayment.title: Provides comprehensive information for a single payment.
RetrievePayment.description: Provides comprehensive information for a single payment.

get_v1__location_id__refunds.title: Provides the details for all refunds initiated by a merchant or any of the merchant's mobile staff during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length.
get_v1__location_id__refunds.description: Provides the details for all refunds initiated by a merchant or any of the merchant's mobile staff during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length.

post_v1__location_id__refunds.title: Issues a refund for a previously processed payment. You must issue a refund within 60 days of the associated payment.
post_v1__location_id__refunds.description: Issues a refund for a previously processed payment. You must issue a refund within 60 days of the associated payment.

ListSettlements.title: Provides summary information for all deposits and withdrawals initiated by Square to a merchant's bank account during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length.
ListSettlements.description: Provides summary information for all deposits and withdrawals initiated by Square to a merchant's bank account during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length.

RetrieveSettlement.title: Provides comprehensive information for a single settlement, including the entries that contribute to the settlement's total.
RetrieveSettlement.description: Provides comprehensive information for a single settlement, including the entries that contribute to the settlement's total.

BatchDeleteCatalogObjects.title: BatchDeleteCatalogObjects
BatchDeleteCatalogObjects.description:
Deletes a set of [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem)s based on the
provided list of target IDs and returns a set of successfully deleted IDs in
the response. Deletion is a cascading event such that all children of the
targeted object are also deleted. For example, deleting a CatalogItem will
also delete all of its [CatalogItemVariation](#type-catalogitemvariation)
children.

`BatchDeleteCatalogObjects` succeeds even if only a portion of the targeted
IDs can be deleted. The response will only include IDs that were
actually deleted.

BatchRetrieveCatalogObjects.title: BatchRetrieveCatalogObjects
BatchRetrieveCatalogObjects.description:
Returns a set of objects based on the provided ID.
Each [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem) returned in the set includes all of its
child information including: all of its
[CatalogItemVariation](#type-catalogitemvariation) objects, references to
its [CatalogModifierList](#type-catalogmodifierlist) objects, and the ids of
any [CatalogTax](#type-catalogtax) objects that apply to it.

BatchUpsertCatalogObjects.title: BatchUpsertCatalogObjects
BatchUpsertCatalogObjects.description:
Creates or updates up to 10,000 target objects based on the provided
list of objects. The target objects are grouped into batches and each batch is
inserted/updated in an all-or-nothing manner. If an object within a batch is
malformed in some way, or violates a database constraint, the entire batch
containing that item will be disregarded. However, other batches in the same
request may still succeed. Each batch may contain up to 1,000 objects, and
batches will be processed in order as long as the total object count for the
request (items, variations, modifier lists, discounts, and taxes) is no more
than 10,000.

CatalogInfo.title: CatalogInfo
CatalogInfo.description:
Returns information about the Square Catalog API, such as batch size
limits for `BatchUpsertCatalogObjects`.

ListCatalog.title: ListCatalog
ListCatalog.description:
Returns a list of [CatalogObject](#type-catalogobject)s that includes
all objects of a set of desired types (for example, all [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem)
and [CatalogTax](#type-catalogtax) objects) in the catalog. The types parameter
is specified as a comma-separated list of valid [CatalogObject](#type-catalogobject) types:
`ITEM`, `ITEM_VARIATION`, `MODIFIER`, `MODIFIER_LIST`, `CATEGORY`, `DISCOUNT`, `TAX`.

DeleteCatalogObject.title: DeleteCatalogObject
DeleteCatalogObject.description:
Deletes a single [CatalogObject](#type-catalogobject) based on the
provided ID and returns the set of successfully deleted IDs in the response.
Deletion is a cascading event such that all children of the targeted object
are also deleted. For example, deleting a [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem)
will also delete all of its
[CatalogItemVariation](#type-catalogitemvariation) children.

RetrieveCatalogObject.title: RetrieveCatalogObject
RetrieveCatalogObject.description:
Returns a single [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem) as a
[CatalogObject](#type-catalogobject) based on the provided ID. The returned
object includes all of the relevant [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem)
information including: [CatalogItemVariation](#type-catalogitemvariation)
children, references to its
[CatalogModifierList](#type-catalogmodifierlist) objects, and the ids of
any [CatalogTax](#type-catalogtax) objects that apply to it.

SearchCatalogObjects.title: SearchCatalogObjects
SearchCatalogObjects.description:
Queries the targeted catalog using a variety of query types
([CatalogQuerySortedAttribute](#type-catalogquerysortedattribute),
([CatalogQueryExact](#type-catalogqueryexact),
([CatalogQueryRange](#type-catalogqueryrange),
([CatalogQueryText](#type-catalogquerytext),
([CatalogQueryItemsForTax](#type-catalogqueryitemsfortax),
([CatalogQueryItemsForModifierList](#type-catalogqueryitemsformodifierlist)).

UpdateItemModifierLists.title: UpdateItemModifierLists
UpdateItemModifierLists.description:
Updates the [CatalogModifierList](#type-catalogmodifierlist) objects
that apply to the targeted [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem) without having
to perform an upsert on the entire item.

UpdateItemTaxes.title: UpdateItemTaxes
UpdateItemTaxes.description:
Updates the [CatalogTax](#type-catalogtax) objects that apply to the
targeted [CatalogItem](#type-catalogitem) without having to perform an
upsert on the entire item.

CreateCustomer.title: CreateCustomer
CreateCustomer.description:
Creates a new customer for a business, which can have associated cards on file.

You must provide __at least one__ of the following values in your request to this
endpoint:

- `given_name`
- `family_name`
- `company_name`
- `email_address`
- `phone_number`

This endpoint does not accept an idempotency key. If you accidentally create
a duplicate customer, you can delete it with the
[DeleteCustomer](#endpoint-deletecustomer) endpoint.

DeleteCustomer.title: DeleteCustomer
DeleteCustomer.description: Deletes a customer from a business, along with any linked cards on file.

RetrieveCustomer.title: RetrieveCustomer
RetrieveCustomer.description: Returns details for a single customer.

UpdateCustomer.title: UpdateCustomer
UpdateCustomer.description:
Updates the details of an existing customer.
The ID of the customer may change if the customer has been merged into another customer.

You cannot edit a customer's cards on file with this endpoint. To make changes
to a card on file, you must delete the existing card on file with the
[DeleteCustomerCard](#endpoint-deletecustomercard) endpoint, then create a new one with the
[CreateCustomerCard](#endpoint-createcustomercard) endpoint.

CreateCustomerCard.title: CreateCustomerCard
CreateCustomerCard.description:
Adds a card on file to an existing customer. In the United States
Square takes care of automatically updating any cards on file that might
have expired since you first attached them to a customer.

DeleteCustomerCard.title: DeleteCustomerCard
DeleteCustomerCard.description: Removes a card on file from a customer.

get_v2_locations.title: ListLocations
get_v2_locations.description:
Provides the details for all of a business's locations.

Most other Connect API endpoints have a required `location_id` path parameter.
The `id` field of the [`Location`](#type-location) objects returned by this
endpoint correspond to that `location_id` parameter.

CreateCheckout.title: CreateCheckout
CreateCheckout.description:
Creates a [Checkout](#type-checkout) response that links a
`checkoutId` and `checkout_page_url` that customers can be directed to in
order to provide their payment information using a payment processing
workflow hosted on connect.squareup.com.

get_v2_locations__location_id__refunds.title: ListRefunds
get_v2_locations__location_id__refunds.description:
Lists refunds for one of a business's locations.

Refunds with a `status` of `PENDING` are not currently included in this
endpoint's response.

Max results per [page](#paginatingresults): 50

ListTransactions.title: ListTransactions
ListTransactions.description:
Lists transactions for a particular location.

Max results per [page](#paginatingresults): 50

Charge.title: Charge
Charge.description:
Charges a card represented by a card nonce or a customer's card on file.

Your request to this endpoint must include _either_:

- A value for the `card_nonce` parameter (to charge a card nonce generated
with the `SqPaymentForm`)
- Values for the `customer_card_id` and `customer_id` parameters (to charge
a customer's card on file)

In order for an e-commerce payment to potentially qualify for
[Square chargeback protection](https://squareup.com/help/article/5394), you
_must_ provide values for the following parameters in your request:

- `buyer_email_address`
- At least one of `billing_address` or `shipping_address`

When this response is returned, the amount of Square's processing fee might not yet be
calculated. To obtain the processing fee, wait about ten seconds and call
[RetrieveTransaction](#endpoint-retrievetransaction). See the `processing_fee_money`
field of each [Tender included](#type-tender) in the transaction.

RetrieveTransaction.title: RetrieveTransaction
RetrieveTransaction.description: Retrieves details for a single transaction.

CaptureTransaction.title: CaptureTransaction
CaptureTransaction.description:
Captures a transaction that was created with the [Charge](#endpoint-charge)
endpoint with a `delay_capture` value of `true`.

See [Delayed capture transactions](/articles/delayed-capture-transactions/)
for more information.

post_v2_locations__location_id__transact.title: CreateRefund
post_v2_locations__location_id__transact.description:
Initiates a refund for a previously charged tender.

You must issue a refund within 120 days of the associated payment. See
(this article)[https://squareup.com/help/us/en/article/5060] for more information
on refund behavior.

VoidTransaction.title: VoidTransaction
VoidTransaction.description:
Cancels a transaction that was created with the [Charge](#endpoint-charge)
endpoint with a `delay_capture` value of `true`.

See [Delayed capture transactions](/articles/delayed-capture-transactions/)
for more information.
